content: azalea crochet cardigan an easy any season cardigan for baby written for crocheters who can t make patterns work by amy hoover aymond size baby 0-9 months materials 220 yards of worsted yarn 4 25mm or us h crochet hook 2 1/2 buttons safety pin style stitch markers yarn needle for weaving in ends sewing needle for attaching buttons skills needed chain single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet this cardigan is crocheted in one piece using half_double_crochet stitch it begins at the neck you will increase to a circular yoke working back and forth in row start by chaining 29 stitches loosely skip the first chain work 28 half_double_crochet across chain at the start of each row from here chain 2 this will always count as your first stitch chain 2 then work 27 half_double_crochet because those 2 chains count as 1 remember across one in each existing stitch turn increase 1 work 2 half_double_crochet in each existing stitch but remember chain 2 then work one half_double_crochet in that stitch so you have your 2 in that stitch this will double your stitch count to 56 work 2 row with one half_double_crochet in each stitch increase 2 2 half_double_crochet in one stitch followed by 1 half_double_crochet in the next repeat all the way across this will increase your stitch count to 84 work 3 row plain 1 half_double_crochet in each stitch increase 3 2 half_double_crochet in one stitch followed by a single half_double_crochet in the next two stitches repeat across this will increase your stitch count to 113 work 2 row plain half_double_crochet one in each existing stitch yay your yoke is done it will look similar to this now you will skip stitches and create the cap sleeves ummmmm my stitch count isn t quite right that s ok really just make sure the sections are even and proportional it will work i promise work half_double_crochet in the first 15 stitches for the front skip the next 22 stitches to create the opening for the sleeve folding your yoke in half half_double_crochet in the next 39 stitches the back then skip 22 again for your second sleeve work half_double_crochet across the remaining 15 for the other front work plain in half_double_crochet one in each stitch until desired length ok take a good look at your work you need to choose what will be the outside public side the right side and which will say inside you need to make sure the last row you work in half_double_crochet is the right side after you have worked half_double_crochet all the way across the last row work 2 more half_double_crochet in the last stitch to turn the corner then work one single_crochet in each gap between the row working up the front side toward the neckline as shown in the chart just follow the arrows working the stitches as directed now we will increase to create the collar this will be worked right into the original chained stitches across the original 28 neckline stitches
